resources.string: Welcome to the Passive Aggressive Gardener\'s Guide to Spiting Your Suburban Neighbors. Are you seething at those narcisissts next door who spend thousands of dollars and hours ostentatiously manicuring their gardens, and yet are unaware of their ego's effect on the neighborhood? Who decide that 5am is the perfect time to use the leaf blower? Whose ten corgis just love to shit in your back yard? Who painted their house puke green, and then put up emergency flood lights that light up their horrible domicile like a sickly christmas tree? Whose tree fell on your house during a snowstorm, but your insurance refused to cover it and they refused to even file a claim? Who leaves their "classic" diesel Mercedes Benz running for an hour to "warm it up" on a cold morning, threatening your family with carbon monoxide poisoning? Whose asshole teenage son uses your pets as paintball targets? I know confrontation can be tough and often it's not worth the trouble, but that doesn't mean you're out of options. Some inventive landscaping might be just what you need to get under your neighbors' skin. Check out our exciting collection of aggressive, competitive, durable species guaranteed to invade their yard, usurp their soil nutrients, kill their trees, and eradicate those ugly little flowers they spent thousands of dollars on and countless hours planting. Happy avenging!
This deciduous woody vine can grow to a height of 40 ft. Good luck getting that down!
Growing up to 15 feet tall, this weed can handle harsh conditions and still spreads rapidly. It is classified as an invasive species in 39 of the 50 United States, so why not add yours to the list!
English Ivy is a rampant, clinging evergreen vine that has been known to crowd out and choke other plants, creating an \"ivy desert\".
This tree smells foul, and because it resprouts vigorously when cut, your neighbors\' efforts to suppress this beast will drive them crazy for decades to come!

Garlic Mustard is, as the name suggests, and odorous weed from the Mustard Family that is essentially impossible to suppress because nearly no animals eat it, and the insects and fungi that would normally do so are not native to its present North American habitat. It also produces chemicals that suppress the fungi most other plants need for optimum growth.
Your neighbors will never suspect that these beautiful orange blossoms behave just as maddeningly as any perennial weed.
Also known as Japanese arrowroot, Kudzu is a lovely vine that climbs over trees or shrubs and grows so rapidly that it kills them by depriving them of any light.
This showy and aggressive ornamental tree should get along great with your neighbors!
Oriental Bittersweet grows aggressively, smothering trees, shrubs, and other irritating entities like your neighbors. Just kidding.
Bamboo is a giant grass, and a giant pain in the ass. Once established, it is impossible to control, for each sprout that shoots up from the ground can grow 12 inches a day. That'll teach 'em.
